maml:description.maml:para: Adds a data source to a Data Lake Analytics account.
The AzureRmDataLackAnalyticsDataSource cmdlet adds a data source to an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage account to add.
Specifies the access key of the Azure Blob storage account to add.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the name of the Azure Data Lake Store account to add.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the access key of the Azure Blob storage account to add.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage account to add.
Specifies the name of the Azure Data Lake Store account to add.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a data source to an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a Data Lake Store data source to a Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a Data Lake Analytics account.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet gets information about an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:description.maml:para: The specified account details.
The list of accounts in the specified resource group or subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get information about a Data Lake Analytics account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about the account named ContosoAdlAccount.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a Data Lake Analytics catalog item or types of items.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem gets a specified Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog item, or gets catalog items of a specified type.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the catalog item type of the item(s) being fetched or listed. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Database
- Schema
- Assembly
- Table
- TableValuedFunction
- TableStatistics
- ExternalDataSource
- View
- Procedure
- Secret
- Credential
- Types
- TablePartition
Specifies the multi-part path to the item to retrieve, or to the parent item of the items to list. The parts of the path should be separated by a period (.).
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the catalog item type of the item(s) being fetched or listed. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Database
- Schema
- Assembly
- Table
- TableValuedFunction
- TableStatistics
- ExternalDataSource
- View
- Procedure
- Secret
- Credential
- Types
- TablePartition
Specifies the multi-part path to the item to retrieve, or to the parent item of the items to list. The parts of the path should be separated by a period (.).

maml:description.maml:para: The specified catalog item.
The list of the specified catalog items underneath their corresponding container.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a specified database

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the specified database.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get tables in a specified database and schema

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a list of tables in the specified database.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a Data Lake Analytics data source.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsDataSource cmdlet gets an Azure Data Lake Analytics data source.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account that this cmdlet gets data sources.
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage data source.
Specifies the resource group name that contains the data source.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account that this cmdlet gets data sources.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the resource group name that contains the data source.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account that this cmdlet gets data sources.
Specifies the name of the Azure Blob Storage data source.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the resource group name that contains the data source.

maml:description.maml:para: The specified Azure Storage account details.
The specified Data Lake Store account details
The list of both Azure Storage accounts and Data Lake Store accounts in the specified Data Lake Analytics account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a data source from an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a Data Lake Store data source named ContosoAdls from a Data Lake Analytics account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get the list of Data Lake Store accounts in a Data Lake Analytics account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all Data Lake Store accounts from a Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a Data Lake Analytics job.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet gets an Azure Data Lake Analytics job. If you do not specify a job, this cmdlet gets all jobs.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the ID of the job to get.
Specifies options that indicate the type of additional information to retrieve about the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- DebugInfo
- Statistics
- All
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies a name to use to filter the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- DebugInfo
- Statistics
- All
Specifies the email address of a user. Use this parameter to filter the job list results to jobs submitted by a specified user.
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted after the specified date.
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted before the specified date.
Specifies a state filter for the job results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Accepted
- New
- Compiling
- Scheduling
- Queued
- Starting
- Paused
- Running
- Ended
Specifies a result filter for the job results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- Cancelled
- Failed
- Succeeded
An optional value which indicates the number of jobs to return. Default value is 500
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies options that indicate the type of additional information to retrieve about the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- DebugInfo
- Statistics
- All
Specifies the ID of the job to get.
Specifies a name to use to filter the job list results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- DebugInfo
- Statistics
- All
Specifies a result filter for the job results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- None
- Cancelled
- Failed
- Succeeded
Specifies a state filter for the job results. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Accepted
- New
- Compiling
- Scheduling
- Queued
- Starting
- Paused
- Running
- Ended
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted after the specified date.
Specifies a date filter. Use this parameter to filter the job list result to jobs submitted before the specified date.
Specifies the email address of a user. Use this parameter to filter the job list results to jobs submitted by a specified user.
An optional value which indicates the number of jobs to return. Default value is 500

maml:description.maml:para: The specified job information details
The list of jobs in the specified Data Lake Analytics account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a specified job

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the job with the specified ID.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get jobs submitted in the past week

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets jobs submitted in the past week.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Data Lake Analytics account.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet creates an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account. To create a resource group, use the New-AzureRmResourceGroup cmdlet.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the location at which to create the Data Lake Analytics account. Only East US 2 is supported at this time.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.
The optional maximum supported degree of parallelism for this account. If none is specified, defaults to 30
The optional maximum supported jobs running under the account at the same time. If none is specified, defaults to 3
The optional number of days that job metadata is retained. If none specified, the default is 30 days.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to set as the default data source.
Specifies the location at which to create the Data Lake Analytics account. Only East US 2 is supported at this time.
The optional maximum supported degree of parallelism for this account. If none is specified, defaults to 30
The optional maximum supported jobs running under the account at the same time. If none is specified, defaults to 3
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
The optional number of days that job metadata is retained. If none specified, the default is 30 days.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account. To create a resource group, use the New-AzureRmResourceGroup cmdlet.
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

maml:description.maml:para: The details of the newly created account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a Data Lake Analytics account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Data Lake Analytics account named ContosoAdlAccount that uses the ContosoAdlStore Data Store, in the resource group named ContosoOrg.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog credential.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogCredential cmdlet creates a new credential to use in an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog for connecting to external data sources.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the credential.
Specifies the name and password of the credential.
Specifies the user name and corresponding password of the credential.
Specifies the host name of the external data source the credential can connect to in the format mydatabase.contoso.com.
Specifies the port number used to connect to the specified DatabaseHost using this credential.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the credential.
Specifies the name and password of the credential.
Specifies the user name and corresponding password of the credential.
Specifies the full Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the external data source this credential can connect to.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the user name and corresponding password of the credential.
Specifies the name and password of the credential.
Specifies the host name of the external data source the credential can connect to in the format mydatabase.contoso.com.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the credential.
Specifies the port number used to connect to the specified DatabaseHost using this credential.
Specifies the full Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the external data source this credential can connect to.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a credential for a catalog specifying host and port

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the specified credential for the specified account, database, host and port using https protocol.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a credential for a catalog specifying full URI

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the specified credential for the specified account, database and external data source URI.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Data Lake Analytics catalog secret.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecret cmdlet creates a secret to use in an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the secret.
Specifies the name and password of the secret.
Specifies the host name for the database the secret is associated with in the format 'mydatabase.contoso.com'.
Specifies the port number of the secret.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the secret.
Specifies the name and password of the secret.
Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the secret.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the host name for the database the secret is associated with in the format 'mydatabase.contoso.com'.
Specifies the name of the database that holds the secret.
Specifies the port number of the secret.
Specifies the name and password of the secret.
Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the secret.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the secret for a catalog

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the secret corresponding to the specified account, database, credential, and host.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a Data Lake Analytics account.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet permanently deletes an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a Data Lake Analytics account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet modifies an Azure Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies key-value pairs that can be used to identify the Data Lake Analytics account among other Azure resources.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
The optional maximum supported degree of parallelism to update the account with.
The optional maximum supported jobs running under the account at the same time to set.
The optional number of days that job metadata is retained to set in the account.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

maml:description.maml:para: Submits a job.
The Submit-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet submits an Azure Data Lake Analytics job.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the job name.
Specifies the contents of the script to run.
Specifies the runtime version of the job.
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Semantic
- Full
- SingleBox
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the job name.
Specifies the local file path to the script to run.
Specifies the runtime version of the job.
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Semantic
- Full
- SingleBox
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the compilation mode of the job. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Semantic
- Full
- SingleBox
Indicates that this cmdlet compiles the job without running it.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics Units (DLAU) of the job, which indicates the maximum allowable parallelism of the job.
Specifies the job name.
Specifies the priority of the job. If not specified, the priority is 1000. A lower the number indicates a higher job priority.
Specifies the runtime version of the job.
Specifies the contents of the script to run.
Specifies the local file path to the script to run.

maml:description.maml:para: The initial job details for the submitted job.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics account.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsAccount cmdlet checks for the existence of a Data Lake Analytics account.

Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the resource group name of the Data Lake Analytics account.

maml:description.maml:para: True or false indicating whether the account exists or not.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks for the existence of a catalog item.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsCatalogItem cmdlet checks for the existence of an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog item.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the catalog item type of the item to check. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Database
- Schema
- Assembly
- Table
- TablePartition
- TableValuedFunction
- TableStatistics
- ExternalDataSource
- View
- Procedure
- Secret
- Credential
- Types
Specifies the path to the item to fetch, or the path to the parent item of the items to list.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the catalog item type of the item to check. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Database
- Schema
- Assembly
- Table
- TablePartition
- TableValuedFunction
- TableStatistics
- ExternalDataSource
- View
- Procedure
- Secret
- Credential
- Types
Specifies the path to the item to fetch, or the path to the parent item of the items to list.

maml:description.maml:para: True or false indicating if the specified catalog item exists or not.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test whether a catalog item exists

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether a specified Schema item exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Waits for a job to complete.
The Wait-AzureRmDataLakeAnalyticsJob cmdlet waits for an Azure Data Lake Analytics job to complete.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the ID of the job for which to wait.
Specify the number of seconds that elapse between each check of the job state.
Specifies the number of seconds to wait before exiting the wait operation.
Specifies the Data Lake Analytics account name.
Specifies the ID of the job for which to wait.
Specifies the number of seconds to wait before exiting the wait operation.
Specify the number of seconds that elapse between each check of the job state.

maml:description.maml:para: The final job details for the completed job.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Wait for a job to complete

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following command waits for the job with the specified ID to complete.
